name: Owen Williams
label: Machine Learning / Software Engineer
summary: Experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a strong technical background in software engineering and cloud technologies. Specialized in developing and deploying ML solutions with increasing focus on Natural Language Processing / LLM applications. Proven track record of delivering complex AI projects from concept to production in regulated environments. Experienced in leading technical teams, mentoring junior colleagues, and driving continuous improvement.

work_experience.summary: Led the AI team developing large ML models and data products to improve NHS clinic efficiency across 50 NHS Trusts
highlights: DNA model to predict patient no-shows and late cancels used by 10 NHS trusts
Visualisation and algorithms to support overbooking, linked appointments and workflows
LLM solutions over patient communications to automate high volume hospital tasks
Full-stack ML - infrastructure, feature engineering, model training/monitoring, and serving
Agentic LLMs prototypes (including RT Voice) using openai, google and langsmith agent sdk

work_experience.summary: Initially worked in R&D exploring new product opportunities, then moved to Advanced Analytic to help move core models to the cloud
highlights: Developed and deployed ML solutions and researched technologies across various Admiral business areas including claims, fraud detection, and pricing
Migrated critical data pipelines and ML models from in-house systems to GCP/Vertex AI
Security champion for ML products on Google Cloud Platform

work_experience.summary: Startup telecomms specialising in SIP and WebRTC.  Bought by Avaya for $140M in 2007 and subsequently spun off to focus on WebRTC
highlights: Developer and architect on core application server for a telephony tech startup
Led integrations with Microsoft, Avaya, and Cisco products
Major role in migrating products to the cloud (kubernetes, istio) incl. DevOps practices

work_experience.summary: Delivered creative and technical solutions for major brands including Nike, Microsoft, Orange, Dominos, and Smithsonian Institute
highlights: Worked in small, agile teams to develop cutting-edge web applications under challenging circumstances
Delivered Orange Mobile's first ecommerce site (Java)
Delivered Dominos online store in 2 months (C#)

work_experience.summary: Fulfilled various development and team-lead roles across projects for BBC, Glaxo, and BT

skills.name: AI
skills.summary: Azure AI Foundry, Google VertexAI, OpenAI

skills.name: CLOUD
skills.summary: Azure, GCP, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, DevOps, Terraform

interests.name: Robotics/electronics
interests.summary: I have a passion for building robots and electronics projects, particularly those that involve machine learning and AI. I enjoy working with microcontrollers and developing custom hardware solutions.

interests.name: Space
interests.summary: Medium level space nerd, ✅ Watch Scott Manley, ✅ Play KSP, ❌ Only 2 space-related t-shirts

interests.name: Guitar
interests.summary: Particularly playing fingerstyle Blues and Folk. Also have a few techical pojects related to learning / notation

interests.name: Cycling
interests.summary: I try to cycle daily.  Mountain biking, gravel, road, I love it!

projects.title: RealTime Voice - using Agentic LLMs for patient Comms
projects.summary: Prototyped inbound patient phone requests being served by agentic models to answer or direct patient queries
highlights: Azure Communications Service - for inbound calls
Compared capabilities of Google ADK, OpenAI Agent SDK and LangSmith
Provided tools to LLMs to provide access to patient context and to expose actions

projects.title: NVidia AI Project: Sheepdog Whistle Neural Network
highlights: Controlling a robot the same way as as a sheepdog, through whistling!
Custom-built JetBot powered by Jetson Nano and a Storm32 motor controller control board
PyTorch neural net is trained with the sounds of different whistles or click sounds represented spectrographically as images

projects.title: Teddington Robotics - Go! (Dual VESC Balancebot Chair)
projects.summary: Built a self balancing chair for my daugter's favourite teddy bear.  The Control Board is a dual VESC (often used in skateboards) but firmware is entirely my own.  Balancing somthing this big/heavy is tricky!

projects.title: Driva Bach: A small Motor Control Board for Gimbal BLDCs
projects.summary: One of many Motor Control Boards I've designed using EasyCad/KiCad. This was printed by JLCPCB.  I'm a contributor to SimpleFOC and have done a lot with BLDCs, stm32, encoders And CanBUS
